Python Package¶

mtd.create_dictionary(language_config: Union[mtd.languages.LanguageConfig, str]) → mtd.dictionary.Dictionary¶

Given a LanguageConfig (or a path to one), create a Dictionary

mtd.create_suite(language_configs: List[Union[str, mtd.languages.LanguageConfig]]) → mtd.languages.suites.LanguageSuite¶

Create a LanguageSuite from a list of LanguageConfigs or paths to language configs

class mtd.dictionary.Dictionary(language_config: mtd.languages.LanguageConfig)¶

A Mother Tongues Dictionary object

  • Properties:
    df (pandas.DataFrame): A parsed, transduced, sorted, joined and indexed DataFrame of the data provided by the language_config that initialized the class instance
  • Attributes:
    config (dict): LanguageConfig name (str): Name of Dictionary data_objs (list): List of dicts containing ResourceManifest and parsed data

Calling len on a Dictionary gives the length of the dataframe ie. how many entries Dictionary is a subscriptable class which access the row in the dataframe at the given index

mtd.dictionary.Dictionary.export_raw_data(self, export_path: str, export_type: str = 'json', flatten: bool = True) → None¶

Use pandas export functions with some sensible defaults to export raw data to xlsx/json/csv/psv/tsv/html Writes file to path. .. note:: Dictionary.export_raw_data exports raw data, not formatted data which is required for Mother Tongues apps
